text: The wicked flee, but no one pursues,
but the righteous is bold like a lion.
By the rebellion of a land, her rulers increase,
but by a person of intelligence who knows justice, it will last.
A man \add who is\add* poor and oppresses the impoverished
\add is\add* a beating rain ⸤that leaves⸥\f + \fr 28:3 \ft Literally “and there is” \f* no food.
Those who forsake instruction will praise the wicked,
but they who guard instruction will struggle against them.
Men of evil do not understand justice,
but seekers of Yahweh understand completely.\f + \fr 28:5 \ft Or “everything” \f*
Better \add to be\add* poor and walking in one’s integrity
than to be crooked of ways when one \add is\add* rich.
He who keeps instruction \add is\add* a child of understanding,
but the companion of gluttons will shame his father.
He who augments his wealth with interest and with usury
gathers it for him who is kind to the poor.
He who turns his ear from listening to instruction,
even his prayer \add is\add* an abomination.
He who misleads the upright onto the way of evil,
into his pits he will fall.
But as for the blameless, they will inherit good.
A man of wealth \add is\add* wise in his own eyes,
but the intelligent poor sees through him.
When the righteous triumphs, great \add is\add* the glory,
but with \add the\add* rising of the wicked, a person will be hidden.
He who conceals his transgression will not prosper,
but he who confesses and forsakes will obtain mercy.
Happy is the person who fears continuously,
but he who is stubborn of heart,\f + \fr 28:14 \ft Or “mind” \f* will fall into calamity.
\add Like\add* a roaring lion and a charging bear
\add is\add* a wicked ruler over a poor people.
A ruler who lacks understanding is\f + \fr 28:16 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* a cruel oppressor,
\add but\add* those who hate unjust gain will have long\f + \fr 28:16 \ft Or “prolong” \f* days.
A person who is burdened with \add the\add* blood of ⸤another⸥,\f + \fr 28:17 \ft Literally “life” \f*
until death he will flee;
do not take hold of him.
He who walks in integrity will be safe,
but he who takes crooked paths will fall in one.
He who tills his ground will have plenty bread,
but he who follows fantasies will have plenty \add of\add* poverty.
A man of faithfulness \add has\add* abundant blessings,
but he who hurries to become rich will not go unpunished.
⸤Showing partiality⸥\f + \fr 28:21 \ft Literally “Recognizing faces” \f* \add is\add* not good,
and over a morsel of bread, a strong man will do wrong.
He who hurries for wealth is ⸤a man with an evil eye⸥,\f + \fr 28:22 \ft Literally “a man of evil of eye” \f*
but he does not know that poverty will come upon him.
He who rebukes a person will afterward find \add more\add* favor
than he who flatters \add with the\add* tongue.
He who robs his father and his mother and says, “There is no crime,”
is partner to a man who corrupts.
The ⸤greedy person⸥\f + \fr 28:25 \ft Literally “wide soul” \f* will stir up strife,
but he who trusts in Yahweh will be enriched.
He who trusts in his own heart\f + \fr 28:26 \ft Or “mind,” or “sense” \f* is a fool,
but he who walks in wisdom will be saved.
\add For\add* he who gives to the poor, there is no lacking,
but \add for\add* he\f + \fr 28:27 \ft Hebrew “those” \f* who turns his eyes, \add there are\add* many curses.
With \add the\add* rising of the wicked, humankind will be hidden,
and with their perishing, \add the\add* righteous will multiply.
